post.author: K. Kwon
post.content:
From: "Kerriann Miller-Kreuz" <kmiller-kreuz@hollisterinc.com> | This is spam | Add to Address Book
To: kwon96@yahoo.com
Subject: Contract Opportunity...Do you know anyone?
Date: Tue, 30 Sep 2003 10:13:29 -0400
      



Hello,
My name is Kerriann Miller-Kreuz. I am a recruiter with Hollister, a Boston, MA based staffing agency. I am doing a search for one of my clients in MA who is looking for a Contract Middleware developer.  The key skills needed are strong C++ development and Tuxedo Middleware development experience.   I was doing a search on the internet and I came across your name. I'm not sure if you're looking for a new position or if the job description below would be something of interest, but please take a look and let me know what you think. If the position is not a fit but you know someone who might be interested any referrals would be greatly appreciated. I look forward to hearing from you.

Thanks,
Kerriann



General Job Purpose:
Join a fast-paced software engineering team developing a next generation distributed middleware product that bridges disparate middleware's including CORBA, MQ-Series, Tibco, Tuxedo and Web Services. Work as a member of the transports team developing adapters to one or more of these middleware systems.

Responsibilities:
Responsible for developing the Tuxedo transport adapter to the system described above.

Experience and Qualifications:

Solid C++ programming skills with a
Minimum of 5 years experience with and understanding of Tuxedo middleware products.
Knowledge of distributed systems and middleware.
Knowledge of SOAP, HTTP, XML, Web Services, CORBA and Java are a plus
BS degree in CS, EE, or equivalent is required.
MS degree with emphasis in operating systems, distributed systems, or real-time systems is a plus.




Kerriann Miller-Kreuz
Senior Consultant
Technology Division
Hollister
31 Milk Street, 6th Floor/Boston, MA  02109

617.654.0225
mailto:kmiller@hollisterinc.com
post.title: Middleware developer
